    • Constructor Detail

      • KafkaConfigStore

        public KafkaConfigStore(java.lang.String topicName,
                        KsqlConfig currentConfig)
        KafkaConfigstore reads, and possibly writes, the KSQL config from/to a given Kafka topic, and merges it with the provided config. It is meant to be used by headless-mode KSQL. The config is written if the topic does not already contain a KSQL config. By merging the provided config with the config saved in Kafka, we can ensure that headless mode KSQL can always run queries compatibly across versions, while still allowing to the user to change some configurations.
        Parameters:
        topicName - The name of the topic to use to store the config.
        currentConfig - The current KSQL config, to be merged with the config stored in Kafka.

    • Method Detail
